text: it's hard to keep those New Year's
resolutions but kit Eaton has three apps
that might help you stick to them this
year free on iOS and Android is the
Astrid task to-do list app the app
allows you to easily enter and modify
tasks like hitting the gym or practicing
the piano then allows you to set
repeating reminders that'll gently nudge
you to make sure you're staying on task
both versions of the app integrate with
a cloud-based database so you can sync
goals on all your devices if a daily
reminder can't get you to exercise more
there's Fatah cracy free on iOS the app
connects you to a social network of
people who share similar fitness goals
by checking in to groups like cyclists
and runners users can post comments on
the workouts and get feedback from other
members the app also awards you points
and reward badges when you finish
activities moving you up on your group's
leader board a little competition from a
friendly community may be exactly what
you need to keep working out finally for
199 on itunes is streaks motivational
calendar the app will keep track the
number of days in a row that you stick
to a resolution like working out each
day you exercise you can cross off that
day on the app's calendar it's much less
sophisticated than the other apps
mentioned here but if you're pushed for
time this makes it ideal because
interacting with it is so fast if all
else fails you could always rely on some
old-school methods to remind you of your
resolutions
you
